video.title: Wildest Islands
video.synopsis: From leatherback sea turtles of the Caribbean to indigenous people of Oceania, get an in-depth look at the animals and people of the world's islands.

episodes.synopsis: Africa's Zanzibar archipelago is a much-loved holiday destination, but bizarre creatures -- many of enormous size -- also roam the islands.
episodes.title: Zanzibar: Land of Giants

episodes.synopsis: Each of the Caribbean's 7,000 islands and reefs -- from just a few meters wide to hundreds of kilometers across -- is home to its own unique wildlife.
episodes.title: The Caribbean: The Wild Side of Paradise

episodes.synopsis: The Galapagos archipelago's wilderness is pristine; human influence has been so limited that it allowed one man to rethink the laws of nature.
episodes.title: Galapagos: Darwin's Eden

episodes.synopsis: Two monsoons strike Sri Lanka each year, drenching the plains with weeks of torrential rain. The rest of the year, animals endure months of drought.
episodes.title: Sri Lanka: Monsoon Islands

episodes.synopsis: Among the Hebrides archipelago's many treacherous elements is the world's third-largest whirlpool, whose roar can be heard up to 16 kilometers away.
episodes.title: The Hebrides: Land of Legends

episodes.synopsis: Japan's 7,000 islands cover a range of climates, from frozen seas and snowcapped mountains to sun-kissed beaches and steamy mangroves.
episodes.title: Japan: Land of Extremes

episodes.synopsis: In the Amazon rain forest, the Anavilhanas and Mariua archipelagos are surrounded not by clear waters but by flooded forests and hidden dangers.
episodes.title: Amazon River Islands: The Floating Forests

episodes.synopsis: Vancouver Island's glaciers fuel some of Canada's tallest waterfalls, and a system of rivers and creeks provides Pacific salmon with an ideal habitat.
episodes.title: Vancouver Island: Rivers of Life

episodes.synopsis: The Philippines is home to many rare animals, including the bearcat, which looks like a cross between a bear and a cat but is related to neither.
episodes.title: Philippines: Islands of Mystery

episodes.synopsis: Rugged mountains and expansive coastline remain unblemished by human expansion, making the Falklands a unique home for wildlife, especially penguins.
episodes.title: Falkland Islands: Penguin Paradise
